refnamediv.refpurpose: Tool for operating on configured PKCS#11 modules

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: p11-kit is a command line tool that can be used to perform operations on PKCS#11 modules configured on the system.
See the various sub commands below. The following global options can be used:

listitem.para: Run in verbose mode with debug output.
Run in quiet mode without warning or failure messages.

refsect1.title: List Modules
refsect1.para: List system configured PKCS#11 modules.
The modules, information about them and the tokens present in the PKCS#11 modules will be displayed.

refsect1.title: List Objects
refsect1.para: List objects of a token.
This retrieves all objects of the given token and displays some of their common attributes.

refsect1.title: Export Object
refsect1.para: Export object matching PKCS#11 URI.
If a given URI references a storage object that is a X.509 certificate, it displays the concents of the certificate in PEM format.

refsect1.title: Delete Object
refsect1.para: Delete objects matching PKCS#11 URI.
This destroys every storage object matching given PKCS#11 URI.

refsect1.title: List Profiles
refsect1.para: List PKCS#11 profiles supported by the token.
This searches the given token for profile objects that contain profile IDs which are then displayed in human-readable form.

refsect1.title: Add Profile
refsect1.para: Add PKCS#11 profile to the token.
Creates a new PKCS#11 profile object on the token if it doesn't already exist.

refsect1.title: Delete Profile
refsect1.para: Delete PKCS#11 profile from the token.
Searches the token for profile object that matches given PKCS#11 profile ID and attempts to destroy it.

refsect1.title: Print Config
refsect1.para: Print merged configuration.
P11-kit provides 3 levels of configuration: system wide, per-module, and per-user. At run-time all 3 levels are merged into a single configuration. This command displays the merged configuration.

refsect1.title: Extract
refsect1.para: Extract certificates from configured PKCS#11 modules.
This operation has been moved to a separate command trust extract. See trust1 for more information

refsect1.title: Server
refsect1.para: Run a server process that exposes PKCS#11 module remotely.
refsect1.programlisting: $ p11-kit server pkcs11:token1 pkcs11:token2 ... $ p11-kit server --provider /path/to/pkcs11-module.so pkcs11:token1 pkcs11:token2 ...
refsect1.para: This launches a server that exposes the given PKCS#11 tokens on a local socket. The tokens must belong to the same module. To access the socket, use p11-kit-client.so module. The server address and PID are printed as a shell-script snippet which sets the appropriate environment variable: P11_KIT_SERVER_ADDRESS and P11_KIT_SERVER_PID.

refsect1.title: Extract Trust
refsect1.para: Extract standard trust information files.
This operation has been moved to a separate command trust extract-compat. See trust1 for more information

refsect1.title: Remote
refsect1.para: Run a PKCS#11 module remotely.
refsect1.programlisting: $ p11-kit remote /path/to/pkcs11-module.so $ p11-kit remote pkcs11:token1 pkcs11:token2 ...
refsect1.para: This is not meant to be run directly from a terminal. But rather in a remote option in a pkcs11.conf5 file.

This exposes the given PKCS#11 module or tokens over standard input and output. Those two forms, whether to expose a module or tokens, are mutually exclusive and if the second form is used, the tokens must belong to the same module.
